titles: An elegy on the death of the most illustrious Lord, the Earl of St. Albans: who departed this life the first day of this instant January, 1684.
publisher: Printed for I. Deacon, at the Angel in Guilt-spur-street, without New-Gate,
notes: Verse: "Go stop the swift-wing'd moments in their flight ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
keywords: St. Albans, Henry Jermyn, --  Earl of, ca. 1604-1684 --  Death and burial --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
